page.title: 01Lower Glen Muick SW Ballater
page.content: This aea is mainly commercially planted conifer woodland. It has an altitude of 200m on the South Deeside Rd to 500 metres near the summit of Meall Dubh. The western edge of the block takes in Lower Gln Girnock, this area is mostly heather moorand and is managed for shooting purposes, i.e. deer stalking and grouse shooting. In this block some 14 houses are occupied, mostly assocated with agricutlre and including retired estae workers. The mansion house of Birkhall is only occupied during the summer months and is located on the bank of the River Muick, which is the boundary between the estates of Birkhall andGlen Muick. On the eastern edge of the block, squares 8 and 12 contour an area of natural birchwood, a habitat which is becoming increasingly rare_ in the highlands. This are is heavily
